__e: James... Um, now I don't wish to be rude, but you strike me as someone not entirely very successful with the ladies. Am I right?
I don't mean to be rude, but you don't see that every day.
I mean, not to be an impolite host, but I think it's about time we both got what we came here for.
Is it impolite not to do it considering she's offered and it's her place?
I don't mean to be rude, but I didn't even really remember who you were.
It's very rude not to do as another does when you are under his roof.
First of all, very uncool using my real name, and second, you did steal my idea.
When I met him, I was not allowed to say his name because he'd been very rude and he wanted to remain my friend.
No, I... Now, that's fairly rude and not true at all.
Just because you lost your legs doesn't mean you can be rude with me.
Because your friend was rude to her, and then you went to dinner with him.
Because you came to my girl party, and you were rude to everyone, you were rude to me, you tried to leave early, you broke my new house, - and y...
You know what, sir, that is very rude of you, and...
Hopefully, you don't have much to do with her anymore. Because that's particularly unkind of her.
A break-in? You mean one of the neighbors was rude enough not to leave their keys in the front door?
You know what, sir, that is very rude of you, and...
Hopefully, you don't have much to do with her anymore. Because that's particularly unkind of her.
